intro: Banisteria leptocarpa, commonly known as the red-fruit banisteria, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, opposite leaves. Its most distinctive feature is its bright red, fleshy fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a gelatinous pulp. Banisteria leptocarpa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
